block.para: We introduce the concept of orientation of \RNr[n] as a means for distinguishing an object in \RNr[n] from its mirrored image. In this preview we only discuss the visualizable dimensions 1,2,3.

block.para: We also explain the relationship between orientation of 3-space and rotation about an oriented axis according to the right/left hand rule.
